DataElement.preferredName: Umbilical Cord Blood Manipulation Reagent Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the umbilical cord blood manipulation reagent.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Blood from the umbilical cord of a newborn baby. This blood contains high concentrations of stem cells (cells from which all blood cells develop)._Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner._Any natural or synthetic substance used in a chemical or biological reaction in order to produce, identify, or measure another substance. [Manually curated]

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of autologous lymphocytes for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for leukemia or lymphoma.:Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.

Concepts.definition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of hematopoietic progenitor cells for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for a hematopoietic disorder.
Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.

Property.preferredDefinition: A chemical that has general laboratory application and that is not labeled or otherwise intended for a specific application. General purpose reagents include cytological preservatives, decalcifying reagents, fixatives and adhesives, tissue processing reagents, isotonic solutions, and pH buffers.

Concepts.definition: Any natural or synthetic substance used in a chemical or biological reaction in order to produce, identify, or measure another substance.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A proprietary system for processing and storing total nucleated cells from human umbilical cord blood before banking.

Concepts.definition: A proprietary system for processing and storing total nucleated cells from human umbilical cord blood before banking.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

Concepts.definition: A synthetic, nonionic hydroxyethyl derivative of starch used as a plasma expander when prepared in an isotonic solution. Upon intravenous administration, hydroxyethyl starch colloid increases blood volume and thus improves circulation. This agent is almost exclusively excreted by the kidneys and is potentially nephrotoxic.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.
